title: EIR (Entrepreneur In Residence) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was exceptional in every way. The professionalism, expertise, and passion of the panelists, coupled with the inclusive and dynamic culture of the organization. impressed by the panel's commitment to inclusivity and diversity. They emphasized the importance of fostering an inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and backgrounds.
Interview Questions: If you could solve any problem, what will it be and why ?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Long process, I had one phone call, one zoom interview and 5 in person interviews, two assessments. The panel was friendly, the culture was welcoming too. The interviewers typically consist of members from the department or program the candidate would be coordinating. The interview begins with a warm greeting and an opportunity for the candidate to briefly introduce themselves. The interviewers then delve into the candidate's professional background, asking questions about their previous experience in program coordination, event planning, and project management.
Interview Questions: What would you tell MIT student to convince him of the program.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The work interview at MIT was an incredibly engaging and insightful experience. The interviewers demonstrated a deep understanding of the field, asking thought-provoking questions that challenged me to showcase my skills, knowledge, and potential. Their professionalism and expertise made it a truly valuable opportunity for personal and professional growth.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your background. Why are you interested in working at MIT? What specific skills and qualifications do you bring to this position? How does your previous experience relate to the role you are applying for? Describe a challenging project or situation you faced and how you handled it.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Positive experience overall. The team was very friendly and open about my perceived strengths and weaknesses, and we were able to discuss them in detail. The process felt very fair.
Interview Questions: Asked about my fundraising experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with Professor at his office. Asked about my experience in the class topics and previous teaching and working with students experience. Discussed the logistics of the course, expectations and hours. Overall very good experience and I was briefed on what the job would entail.
Interview Questions: Previous experience teaching classes and working with students

title: Visiting Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview with the lab instructor to understand your interests and explain lab needs. You will then work on getting your paperwork done to visit the USA. Their teams are very efficient and the process is easy!
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward nothing out of the normal of why would you like to work here. Lasted all of 15mins from start to finish. I did decline offer, but would consider another position
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, people were very kind, environment was very welcoming, facilities were very clean and inspection ready, and overall had a great time with the hiring team and the people in general
Interview Questions: In 30 words or less, tell me about yourself?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Submit the CV to the application system. Indicate several professors you'd like to work with. And the professors who are interested in you will send interview invitations. Interview basically involves chatting about research experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research projects.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview direct and to the point, they were very friendly and intellegent with their questions and approach to the position. It was a very smooth conversation and seemed to be full of good information about the role and expectations for the perfect candidate to fill this position at MIT.
Interview Questions: Past experience, priority engagements were a critical focus

title: Master Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I met with one prof and he asked both tech and behav questions. I first introduced myself and the past research experiences. Then he asked some details about the research I did.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and your past experience

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Several phone interviews and a fly out that involved a presentation and full day of in person interviews. My travel and accommodations were covered. I think the timezone change added an extra layer of difficulty. But ultimately I think this was pretty standard for an academic interview process.
Interview Questions: How will you handle lab members that are hard to wrangle or organize?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Varies dependent on boss. Can be easy, but can also be difficult. Should prepare thoroughly beforehand. Reading research summaries, abstracts of recent publications, and maybe even full publications in areas of interest.
Interview Questions: Research interests in the past and future

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed a few days after applying. Had time set up, and had an interview over Zoom. HR wants to hear why you're the best, and will make you feel like you probably aren't if you're not meeting their expectations.
Interview Questions: Standard questions such as "tell me about yourself," and "where do you see yourself in 5 years."

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: They have multiple interview stages with other researchers and practitioners to check on your research qualification, research interests, personal character, funding situations, etc. The whole process takes about a month.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about your recent research topic Q: What do you want to research at our lab. Q: Why our lab? Q. What can you contribute?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Contact hiring professor, and interview directly with professor. Questions are based upon the current needs of the project. Employment is determined based upon the qualifications of the individual and fit in the group.
Interview Questions: Does this project interest you, and what do you expect to do after this job?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter screening then meeting with committee/hiring manager. Phone screen was fine, interview seemed to go well then was ghosted for a month and a half to both positions applied for. Second position the person clearly was not interested in the fact I did not work at an Ivy League institution currently and seemed to dismiss me from there. First position I was not a diverse enough of an applicant..
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you to work at MIT?

title: Machine Learning Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Was straight forward, had take home assignment and also a personal code sample to show. Lots of interesting chats with research scientists working on challenging problems. Great opportunity to help build tooling along with possibly getting published
Interview Questions: Identify errors in a coding sample

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The departmental interview is just one round with three interviewers. In my case only one professor is really close to my research but that almost happens to everyone because not all professor you have on your list will be available. The professor who's working in my field asked more technical questions and details about my past research project, whereas two other professor mainly chatted me through their life experience and why they think MIT is a good place to go.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Tell me about your research interests. Why do you want to do a PhD?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: There isn't one, I'm just forced to write a review to get on here. No calls or zooms or whatever. I did some phone calls to get a sense of some of the professors and their labs but it wasn't mandatory.
Interview Questions: Why do you demand that people pointlessly do this when they don't have useful input?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: All day informational interviews with all the lab mates. Took most of two days. Meet with the PI at the end. Gave a talk. In general chill but stressful. Meet lots of good people
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in the lab?

title: Science Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: One phone screen, one zoom interview with the hiring manager, one all-day in-person interview with faculty members and different departmental officers, as well as follow-on interivews via zoom for other departmental officers who were not available that same day. Did not receive a rejection email.
Interview Questions: How would you communicate complex biomedical concepts to a general public?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with PI, then phone interview with post-doc. Very friendly and interested in what I wanted to do afterwards. Supportive of my professional future. Got the offer and started within 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after MIT?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Long interviews with many folks plus usually starts with HR for salary screening. After that, you will be interviewed by 2 teams with at least 3 people on each committee.
Interview Questions: Lots of situational questions so think about those before showing up.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process entailed 3 interviews as follows: [1] quick informational zoom meeting spanning approximately 20 minutes with assistant and team lead [2] second extended zoom interview lasting around 1.5 hours focusing on a 25 minute presentation with Q&A from all staff and team leads [3] final round in-person interview with team lead and executive director lasting around 1.5 hours.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What is your least favorite part about large scale event planning? How do you incorporate a DEI lens into your work?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview within a day of applying and then offered an in person interview two weeks after. I attended the interview which I think went well and they asked me to complete a task within 4 days. Submitted the finished task and they completely ghosted me, no feedback or even a polite decline email. My request for an update was ignored. I will not be applying at MIT again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MIT specifically?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took several weeks, though the time of year could have impacted this. I had a total of 4 interviews over the length of the hiring process. Approximately every two weeks until the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions based on previous higher education experience

title: HR Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Very easy!  Phone screen first, then two rounds.  Only hitch was that they could not be flexible on dates.  I found the process very simple and I was well taken care of during the course of the interview day.
Interview Questions: What appeals to you about working at MIT?  What is appealing about our mission?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview. They focussed mostly on my research skills and conceptual knowledge related to the proposed research work. They asked many questions related to experimental work. Then, at the end questions were asked from motivation for the PhD position and future scope after PhD.
Interview Questions: What is your motivation to this PhD position?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of 3 interviews: zoom call for an initial screen, 1-hour presentation to all staff followed by specific interview , meeting with executive director and tour of office. Emphasis on presentation skills.
Interview Questions: Asked to present on a large scale event

title: Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: It was a difficult interview, and I did not get the job. It was a great learning experience for what I needed to be better prepared to answer. I wish I could go back in time and redo it!
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself fitting in with the team.

title: Senior Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Scouted by a recruiter who set up preliminary interview. Company requested formal application to be completed on website and set up final interview and skills testing. 
Online application was by far the most intuitive and painless application process I've ever experienced.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: UROP (Student Researcher) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I visited the Media Lab and the interview was conducted inside the hiring manager/head researcher's office. The entire interview took about 30 minutes where they gave me an overview of the position and briefly looked at my resume.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about yourself.

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a panel of 6, each asking a different question. The questions were elaborate and required me to speak about past accomplishments as well as future endeavors. Interviewers were nice, but intense.
Interview Questions: How can you relate to the current students body at MIT, and how would you craft a marketing campaign around them?

title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 virtual interviews followed by an on-site interview. An on-site interview was a half-day interview with various people in different positions/roles within the department including personnel in a senior management role.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: great! thorough questions and logical expertise. showed lots of command and respect for the outlook. the interviewer showed me respect and made sure i was comfortable in the environment. would definitely go back and interview again.
Interview Questions: what was it that you did in school?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Took 2 months from first interview to decision, not much communication between steps during the process, had to reach out for updates. 3 rounds, first with hr for phone screen, hour meeting with the hiring manager, then met with 3 faculty members for the last round.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I chatted with the professor, and he gave me an informal offer. Discussions were about my previous research projects, and he asked me some questions. The process was smooth and pleasant.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit in my lab?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: In fact, I think they had already decided to give me an offer before the interview. So the interview is quite easy, just about the research I did. And it was a phone interview.
Interview Questions: What did I do during my summer research

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The whole process went on 3 weeks.  First round HR, asked basic research background and skills. 2nd round, panel interview by hiring manager, went through the coding of a machine learning project. 3nd round individual interview with the group members. One of the interviewer was very rude unprofessional. Crudely challenged my research is useless. Every researcher needs to respect for other's work. It is lucky I didn't get the offer and don't have to work with such person as a team.
Interview Questions:
machine learning
SQL
Python dataframe
expected salary
why MIT

title: Technology Licensing Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with someone in human resources.  Then interview with hiring manager.  Then multiple separate interview with people in Technology Licensing Office that I would be working with more or less closely.
Interview Questions: Explain how your experiences help prepare you for this job?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty good. They asked me to create a powerpoint presentation. During interview, I presented that and additionally, asked some questions on how I would solve certain problems (like how you would set up the experiment).
Interview Questions: Don't recall but they asked how would I set up an experiment to get certain data.

title: EHS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple overall. It was all through a phone call and I did not feel blindsided by any of the questions. It was straight forward and pretty short.
Interview Questions: What you are most interested in about the job

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions:
Went well they were polite, I got the job. 
It doesn't feel intimidating they feel very friendly towards you and speak to you like a friendly way. I did feel nervous at first but it wasn't difficult to speak to them.
Interview Questions: Did you have any issues in your last job?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very solid. Lots of stages, but for the purpose to ensure that you're passionate about the job and will work well with multiple parts of the team. Would recommend reading into the projects they've funded and brushing up on your experience with fundraising development.
Interview Questions: What does development mean to you?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I had a great time talking with my research supervisor. They were very thorough about the work we are going to do. I was really excited to start! I worked there for a semester.
Interview Questions: What is your previous research experience?

title: Administratitve Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Fair and thorough interview process. It was just really long and drawn out, it could be shortened to make it faster so there is less time waiting for the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Human Resources Coordinator (HR Coordinator) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: 4 rounds of interviews.  A phone conversation, interview with hiring manager, interview with team, interview with department chair. Took over 2 months between applying and hearing back. After the two month period I was told they would go with an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience.

title: UROP Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: easy interview, friendly professor and teammates to talk with easy interview, friendly professor and teammates to talk with easy interview, friendly professor and teammates to talk with easy interview, friendly professor and teammates to talk with
Interview Questions: I don't remember exact questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked about my past coding experience and the projects that I've done. He also gave me some details of the current research project and asked me some questions regarding it. Most importantly, he made sure that the project will tally with my interest and also asked for my time commitment to it. The interview was 30 minutes and was quite enriching for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. Followed by three in person interviews. The first was with the staff team and peers, once I passed that, I interviewed with the program director, and after that I interviewed with the assistant dean.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to be part of this team?

title: Senior Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: From applying to getting a rejection letter, the whole process took over 3 months. I knew it would be intense and long, even for a position that's not very high up in the grand scheme of the school. I had two interviews, one with a recruiter and then a full, 3.5 hour interview with the hiring team. It was a fabulous interview and intimidating in length, but a friend who'd recently gotten an entry level job there said she'd had 4+ interviews including some where she'd had to give a presentation. I got on really well with the team and felt like it was one of the best interviews I'd ever had. The HR partner was upfront about timeline and what to expect. Even though rejections happen, I was hugely disappointed when I finally received word back a week late. After all of that they just sent a short, stock letter type email instead of even giving me a call, with no explanation even though I had 4+ years of experience in the same industry and a very similar role. They just said there was someone better. Standard for interviews, but very disappointed in how poorly they communicated in the end, especially since I made two polite follow ups to ask for feedback and what made the difference with going with someone else! They're pretty rude and just ignored me once they'd decided I wasn't the one.
Interview Questions: When you receive a project, what do you start working on first?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Richardson, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth. First, they gave me details about the position and the responsibilities involved, followed by questions. Several lab members took my interview. They were very sweet and I enjoyed talking to them all.
Interview Questions: What's your long term goal?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Process was straight forward! 3 rounds of interview then received an offer. Competency interview (with a business case), behavioral interview, and last round was a pannel interview, speaking with the entire team, and getting to know them
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
why MIT?
Other questions based on business case

title: Human Resources Administrator for Center for Transportation & Logistics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Head of the department reached out to me over the weekend to schedule an interview for Monday. Got the invite less than 24 hours in advance which is not terrible, but still a red flag. 

I had an hour long zoom interview. The interview itself was easy, discussed my professional background and the opportunity. Nothing difficult.

I was supposed to hear back at the end of that same week, however that didn't happen. So I assumed that I was not selected for this role.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about yourself
- Why do you want to work here
- This is a 6 month position. Are you okay with that?
- General questions

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I had a great experience with the team and they were very communicative throughout the entire interview process. The interview was divided into three separate rounds. Most of the questions were things I expected to be asked based on the role and the full job description.
Interview Questions: Can you please tell us about yourself and your experiences related to this position?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Initial pre-screen call followed by four rounds of zoom interviews with increasingly senior staff. All very friendly and welcoming. Made it to next to last round of interviewing. Received great understanding of position and office structure.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your projects and experience.

title: Senior Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: IT was quick and very technical. I had to write pseudo code and whiteboard the design and architecture topics and questions. There were two people in each panel and two rounds.
Interview Questions: About Core Java, Spring & Hibernate

title: SAM Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: It was just one interview that was less than an hour. I did a video call because I was not in the area. I was called a few weeks later with an offer
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Phd Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: First you submit your application via MIT grad website by December 1, then if selected for an interview they will contact you via email. Interview invite was sent out late January. You are interviewed by 3 people in the program, 1 professor, 1 lab tech, and 1 current student. Interviews are 20 minutes long and conducted over Zoom. Final decisions were sent late February for the program.
Interview Questions: Most of the time was spent discussing what I was interested in researching. A little bit of information also about my background. That was it.

title: Research Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Standard, they asked me typical questions like my relevant experience, if i'd be available, they explained working under COVID and their timeline for coming off of remote work, etc. I asked them a lot of questions as well regarding the position, their research, the project they'd been working on, etc. It was actually a fantastic interview, I followed up with a thank you email, I had very similar previous experience...but in the end they wanted someone with more experience (typical) and told me so in an email that addressed me as Morgan or some other name that's wildly different from my own. At least they doubled back and apologized for that, but the rejection still was for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very smoothly and I was given thorough explanations of the tasks I will be performing. They also gave me a lot of info on the culture of the lab I was applying to.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research experiences

title: Financial Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was questions that encompassed on the spot thinking. Some were concerned with covid-19, others about my interest. It was via Zoom. Only lasted around 15 minutes; it was labeled a screening.
Interview Questions: How is covid-19 affecting the workplace?

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a paper form and an informal transcript showing that I had taken the class I wanted to grade. The math department accepted the form and hired me as a grader.
Interview Questions: What were your grades in the relevant classes?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The different stages of the process included: 
Phone Interview, followed by a Zoom Interview with search committee.
Finally, there was a full day interview with presentation and meeting with different teams
Final 30-minute interview with  director
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience advising students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The process was challenging. Make sure you know what the research group does and  can demonstrate that your prior knowledge will be useful to the group. Be courteous to the Professors and always follow up with an email after your interview to reiterate your interest.
Interview Questions: Background research experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: As part of their MBA interview process, I was asked a series of behavioral based questions ranging from working under pressure, leading a cross-functional team, conflict with a boss, short to long term goals. The interview lasted for about thirty minutes. She was very professional, patient. I received the status of my application within twenty-four hours after the interview
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Virtual interview for 30 min, including a short presentation, PI was very friendly. Got an email offer after I followed up in the third week.
I found the position by direct emailing to PI.
Interview Questions:
Detailed info about my past projects.
Research interests.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Phone call and then on site interview. 1 hour presentation about your previous research and multiple 30 min one on one meetings. The process takes weeks. Then go through HR.
Interview Questions: Previous research

title: MFIN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions:
30min Skype interview + 15min quant test. 
all behavior questions. focus a lot on your resume. So be prepared. 
quant test is pretty easy. knowledge of basic linear algebra and probability is enough
Interview Questions: Why do you choose MFin?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were three phone calls asking about previous research experience, and interest in the subject. One was with the PI. The other phone call was with another member of the lab.
Interview Questions: Give details about your organization in your research.

title: Project Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university's portal.  After receiving an invitation to interview, I met with two members of the archives staff at Hayden Library in Cambridge. I believe that the interview took about 45 minutes.  Both interviewers were friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: For the most part, they asked about my previous experience with archival processing.  Due to the specific nature of the project, they also asked about my ability to read music.

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is kind of informal, with no real channels to get to cool research. You have to know or reach out to some professors in order to really get going.
Interview Questions: What were my past projects?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with a professor, postdoc or professors are rather informal. Sometimes there are UROP postings online that give details about what the lab is looking for, but there is definitely merit to approaching professors personally or via email.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after undergrad?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with PI's. 30 minute presentation on a previous project with ~30 minutes of technical question and answering session followed by introduction to existing project. Have seen others also give an hour long seminar at group meetings.
Interview Questions: What was the key difficulty you had to overcome for this project?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Kind interviewer, we had a nice technical discussion. Then advanced questions on algorithms and data structures using a programming language like design a balanced tree, questions on complexity and programming exercises
Interview Questions: Design a balanced tree

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, meeting with the professor and discussing a bit about the course description and prior experience. It helps if you know the professor beforehand. Values going to prior office hours or engaging in the class.
Interview Questions: Asked about main topics from the course, grade obtained in course, prior experience, etc.

title: Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Virtual hour-long interview with 2 people, then a day-long interview with staff and students. Everyone was very kind and easy to talk to. Took 4 weeks to hear back that they had selected someone else.
Interview Questions: How would you engage MIT students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Submit CV to all potential PI, Some may reply and ask more detail about your bg. If they find a good match, they will either make a skype call or invite you to meet on site (in their office). The meetings are quite different depending on profs. Most people will ask some general questions in their field and ask what your interests are.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join our research group

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Was asked some technical questions  and general experience. Everything done through Skype. Interviewer is my future  direct supervisor,  is very knowledgeable and kind. Questions asked are relevant to the job.
Interview Questions: What projects have you worked on

title: Email Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The process from online application to initial phone screen took almost 2 months. Recruiter on phone interview did not give a background or greetings, just jumped right into a bunch of (about 10)tough behavioral questions that has nothing to do with the actual job responsibilities. Felt like I was being interrogated. Zero interaction, no feedback or anything before jumping to the next questions. It was obvious that questions are from a list and recruiter was reading one after another without really paying attention to my answers. Overall was a very dull and unprofessional phone interview.
Interview Questions: 10 tough behavioral and personality questions.

title: Multiple Positions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included several multiple round, multiple hour interviews which included multiple employees at various levels. Two of the positions either never got back to me and position has been posted over a year later or took weeks to follow up.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MIT?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Process took 5 months, 6 interviews - 3 phone interviews, 3 in-person. Very tough if you are currently employed for not being a supervisor/manager role. Process was very long to not get it.
Interview Questions: Very specific situational questions.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviewers, a list of questions....scenario questions “how would you react....”    “Give an example....”

Then I was asked if I had any questions, which I did, interview ended. 

Overall pleasant, professional interview, not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Give an example ....

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: In person,  I felt  the organization was only interested in non-diverse clones of  what’s already there -  I regret bothering to go in to meet them.   I really wish they were more open about  The unwritten attributes they expect in employees it would’ve saved me time.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Signal Processing Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Lexington, MA)
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed for an entry signal processing engineer position. 
Came in around 9:00am. Waited for a few minutes in front lobby while they gave me a security pass and called the HR coordinator. When the coordinator came, she took me in and walked me to my first interviewer. Ended up interviewing with 4 individuals, and then had lunch with a couple other folks working within the same group. Finished up around noon or 1:00pm. 
All in all it was a pleasant experience and I enjoyed speaking with everyone. I thought the interview went really well, but I didn't end up getting the job.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about this course you listed on your resume.
Tell me why you decided to study signal processing. What is it that excites you about signal processing, and why do you want your work to be focused on this.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: There was phone interview and I got an offer for on-site interview. There were a lot of technical questions  during presentation.  It was not that difficult tho.
Interview Questions: what is your strength.. during phone interview

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied the position through sending the professor my resume.  The interview is arranged three days later through Skype.  I gave a presentation about my PhD study and we had discussions on my research.  He asked a lot of questions and tried to understand what I am doing in my research.
Interview Questions: What is your career plan?

title: Senior Research Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the PI and discussed my resume, education, and past work experience. Overall, the process was very informal, and I heard back from the lab within a week.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Visiting Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: It was an in person interview which was thoughtful and an interesting conversation. Nothing particularly insightful to say about it, it was a straightforward interaction, as such interviews ought to be.
Interview Questions: What do you intend to work on while here?

title: Senior Reactor Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, had a phone interview within the month, and was invited up two weeks after that. Throughout the process, the emphasis is on finding out if you know your own strengths and weaknesses. For the former, describe times when you used them; and for the latter, what did you learn from it / how have you improved. Other parts of the interview were professional (ascertaining you had the appropriate background) and personal (hobbies, workplace/area culture) in nature. Included lunch and a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were asked to work outside your job description responsibilities.

title: Senior Reactor Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview where there was typical STAR type questions.  Only a few questions about nuclear power in general terms.  Face to face interview consisted of a facility tour, face to face interview with 4 others, lunch, talk with HR and two other members of the staff.  Overall very friendly.  Mostly just asked about past experiences and other typical STAR type questions.  Asked several times to describe my own weaknesses.  No POSS tests required.
Interview Questions: What would your current manager say is something you could improve upon?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed 10 minute conversation. We mainly talked over some of the things on my resume. She was very delighted to hear that I was interested in education. She then spent most of the time telling me about the project that I would work on.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you are passionate about education.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It took 2 phone interviews from 2 different labs. In both cases, the lab manager asked me my work experience, future plan and work style stuff. However, about 2 weeks later, they emailed me that they decided on other candidate.
Interview Questions: Describe one of you weakness.

title: Portfolio Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and efficient. My interviewer was very friendly and seemed genuinely interested in learning more about my skills and interests. The whole process was over in a few weeks.
Interview Questions: What technical skills I have

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 faculty members after getting accepted to the Computation for Design and Optimization Program (CDO) now rebranded and the Masters program in Computational Science and Engineering. Both faculty members were very friendly and asked about my previous research experience and how it's relevant to their work. There was also room for me to ask some questions about their research groups.
Interview Questions: 1. Describe your previous research experience. 2. What coursework have you done in computational engineering

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Great full day interview! Very nice to meet so many people and have lunch with students. The process for selecting a candidate was slow but very well thought out.
Interview Questions: What are some of the challenges that are unique to MIT students?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR for phone interview. Basic resume questions and then invited to on site interview. Met with four people separately for about half hour each. No communication after the onsite interview. Not sure if the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Basic resume questions

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews--first a 30 minute phone screen with the hiring manager, then a 1.5 hour in-person with the hiring manager, and finally a 3 hour interview with the hiring manager and two other team members (three separate interviews). From application to offer it took about 2 months.
Interview Questions: What are three accomplishments you are proud of?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Online application including Statement of Objectives, CV, 3 Letters of Recommendation, and short response questions about fairly basic things like research interests and summary of awards/recognition. Notified via email unofficially of acceptance on February 9th. No interview, however some applicants did require an interview. Seems to be a case by case basis for interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe your research interests.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview screen, as well as an on campus day, which included small group, one on one meetings, lunch and a presentation to the staff.  Many staff members from different teams were involved throughout the day and there was a chance to ask questions at each session.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at MIT?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: all went well, no surprises....nothing to report, just the usual academic job talk,etc ...I have to keep writing so I will, but I have nothing more to share....thirty words is a lot on this topic
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a few professors who I thought were interesting things as a current student and some emailed back. We then set up a time to meet. After making sure I would be committed to the project, I joined.
Interview Questions:
"Are you familiar with this technology being used"
"How much time do you have per week"

title: Director, Strategic Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with resume and cover letter. Had a phone screen with HR/admin who asked about salary requirements etc. Made that cut. Then asked to provide writing samples AND goals and audiences I'd target and methods to reach them and more--basically a plan of action. Too much info to ask of a prospect before they've met anyone in person. Plus, its asking the candidate to do some of the most important strategic work without compensation.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for re: salary?

title: Visitor Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Positive interview experience, engaged and encouraging interviewer who was a pleasure to speak with. If other options hadn't been on the table, would definitely have joined this team. Awesome institution with really interesting and exciting exhibits.
Interview Questions: Why this role?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at MIT in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the MIT Summer Research Program (MSRP). The application is similar to a college application but more in depth. Applicant must write 4 essays about their research experience and their future plans.
Interview Questions: Please tell us how graduate school relates will further your career.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with all members of the lab throughout the whole day. That includes a technical presentation and technical discussions. A 30 min interview with the top boss is also included.
Interview Questions: Why you are not going to industry

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was about 30 minutes, the second was an hour. It was very engaging and not intimidating at all. The hiring managers were very friendly and the overall tone was colloquial and inquisitive. They wanted to learn about it.

Sadly, I never heard another word from them after months, despite following up. This seems to be a very unfortunate trend when it comes to hiring nowadays. Zero courtesy or decency.
Interview Questions: What kind of work excites you? What sort of work do you really dislike doing?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: After my profile was seen on a recruiting drive, I was reached out to and immediately scheduled a Skype interview with the two economics professors conducting research on the effects of R&D subsidies and technological progress.
Interview Questions: 2 technical case-type questions regarding econometric models and 2 questions about general understanding of economic theories relevant to the research

title: Education Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for a phone interview. Most of the phone interview involved describing the position as it had been listed in the job description. Then I was asked to do a Skype interview during which I was supposed to 10 minute scientific presentation for 6-12th grade students. I did a very nice job with my presentation (I asked for feedback). Yet, I was not told this would be followed by an additional interview . The types of questions asked and they way in which they were delivered made it clear the interviewers were trying to discredit me for the position. In the end, I did not receive an offer but looking back I am glad for this because the interview left a bad taste in my mouth and I could tell I would have been miserable working there.
Interview Questions: If you could use give yourself one piece of advice when you started, what would it be?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Washington, DC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very easy, they asked me what me interest was in Science and if there were any specific topics I was interested in within the Biological Sciences specifically.
Interview Questions: What interested you in our program?

title: Financial Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview very formal. Close to an in-person interview. Be prepare to give details about works experience by telling stories not by listing skills. They also wanted details about the depth of skills in Excel.  They look for people not only with accounting skills but equally with good customer service skills.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult people.

title: Communications and Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the online portal and was contacted by the hiring manager to set up a 20-minute Skype interview.  HM asked that I submit writing samples and complete a case study assignment to submit to the committee before the interview. Despite logging on to Skype 30 minutes early, there were technical difficulties (Skype is the worst), so I had 14 minutes total to speak with five people, who each asked questions. Most of them sat far from the laptop they were using, so questions had to be repeated to be understood. The writing samples and case study work were never discussed. I received an email three weeks later from the hiring manager saying that they were pursuing another candidate.
Interview Questions: If you could remove one duty from this job description, what would you choose?

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: There is a brief training period and a few meetings with management. The interview process isn't overly rigorous if you have a good attitude and demonstrate a willingness to learn the tour content.
Interview Questions: Shadow a current tour guide then give a practice tour of your own after completing a test demonstrating proficiency of campus / tour guide knowledge.

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Most professors will invite you onsite for a talk, then you will speak to each one of their students. Generally the way to get in is to have people like you, not to come off as a "know-it-all".
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to MIT?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager failed to inform me to what extent and how many interviews I would be involved in that day. I was interviewed by the whole division team, nearly 10 different people. The whole process took about 3 hours. The team was extremely nice and had relatively basic questions.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with others?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a very short interview. The interviewer asked my interest in the position, then asked if I had any other questions for him. I wasn't sure if that was how all interviews went or if he wanted to cut my interview short due to lack of interest in my candidacy.
Interview Questions: Why does this position interest you?

title: Freelance Copy Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with two people. Pleasant, friendly, professional, asked pertinent questions, were open to questions from me. They were honest with me that they had another candidate to talk to, and said they would get back to me. When the manager did a couple weeks later, it was an email to say they'd gone with someone else, but she was kind enough to explain that the other candidate had more website experience.
Interview Questions: How did you help your previous employer to increase their distribution (I had mentioned this on my resume). Tell us about your web-building experience.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I received a Phone interview - my boss asked me standard interview questions in my field.
Fifteen days later I did an in-person group interview with my current team. Everyone had the chance to know me at a personal and professional level. There were two one-hour group interviews. Two months later I received the job offer.
Interview Questions:
What is your favorite part of the work?
What PM software did you use in the past?
Why do you think you can contribute to this team?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and received a call for a 30 min phone interview with the lab team member. The questions were about my previous experiences and some technical part. I didn't get the offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self after five years, why MIT etc

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews at MIT for HR positions. After initial in-person interviews, I did not hear back about the position. It would have been nice to have some communication and closure.
Interview Questions: They asked about challenges in my current role.

title: Database Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was sloppy once my application was sent to the Hiring team. They never replied to my follow up emails.  Leaving me with an impression that they are rude and best that I am not their peer.
Interview Questions: What was one issue you had to deal with and how did you resolve it.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: 40 minutes with the hiring manager. Very pleasant, conversational interview. Basically about my background and why would I like to work there. Also, we discussed their expectations and then the hiring manager answered my questions about work culture, and how it looks like working there.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your best work environment?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen from HR about 1 month after application submitted. Follow-up HR skype interview 1 week later. Two additional skype interviews after another week. On-site interview after another week with 3 other people plus head of HR. NO FOLLOW UPS! They took over a week to reply to each of my emails, most of which said they had "other priorities" that were getting in the way and that they hoped to reply to me "soon." After almost 2 months of this (past on-site interview) they finally said they had moved on to other candidates (in response to my email).

The interviews were pleasant and they covered all costs associated with the on-site trip, but the lack of communications afterward was quite rude.
Interview Questions: Usual interview questions.

title: Cable and Harness Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at MIT (Lexington, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a very professional interview with clear expectation. I was shown the work environment and it was described to me what hardware and software to be used. Shortly after I showed them my work I was told pretty much that they were satisfied and the interview ended much quicker then I expected.
Interview Questions: I how I felt about being a team player.

title: TechCaller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email a couple days later with a student manager to schedule a phone interview. The interview was brief and I received an offer shortly after it.
Interview Questions: What would you say to an alumni over the phone if they say they do not wish to donate to MIT?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Full day meeting with students and postdocs in the same lab. During each 30 min individual meeting, discuss with people about their current research, life, and fun places around MIT. Not stressful as discussions are really casual. Everyone will have their evaluation sent to the PI after the candidate left. Remember, lunch is also part of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What did you do during your PhD.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Simple interview about my experience in the subject of research with the faculty team.
I knew the professor before hand, and I just submitted my CV to complement my application for the job. I helped TAing a class as part of the job as well.
Interview Questions:
Previous experience in the area of research?
Takeaways from that experience.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fine but the program director was incredibly rude and actively snickered and was surprised by my experience. I was interviewed by the current program manager who was leaving and the program director. They both asked questions from a designated list. The program director was very clear that she started the program and seemed to be making a point to let me know things would go through her and she was quite particular about how things were done.
Interview Questions: What do you believe will be the most rewarding and most difficult aspect of the job?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it went well. Met with lab staff in addition to the main professor. Had a group of people all part of the group I would be working in interview me all at once. Took about 3 hours. My experience matched up well with the lab's needs. The McGovern Institute is beautiful and everything seemed top-of-the-line
Interview Questions: Why do want to leave current position?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: skype interview with the team. they asked mainly about the resume , skills you know , for eg. I said I know mysql , so they , how good you are at. also ruby on rails questions.
Interview Questions: mainly questions about resume , what you know

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the head of the lab and assistant over Skype. Shortly after, I was asked for references. Only a few days after that, I received an unofficial offer. Overall, it was a very quick process. During the interview, it was easy to tell that my skills and interests aligned with those of the lab. The questions were straightforward and clearly asked to ensure that I would be a good fit with the lab.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience.

title: Marketing Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers are pretty nice and you won't feel anxious during the process. They also provide with some drinks and snacks. So pretty laid-back atmosphere. And they asked some questions based on your previous experiences.
Interview Questions: Talk briefly about your previous professional experiences

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: She was friendly but they didn't specify what was needed for the position so I was rejected. But they were both very nice and very fast with the process. Overall an okay interview.
Interview Questions: I don't understand why you stayed in one lab for so long.

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions:
It was just a procedure showing that "we have an equal opportunity".... They hire the people they know like friends, etc. so you have no chance. If you do not know hiring director, do not waste your time.

My interview was pretty much fake. They even did not have a question to ask.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: STEM Program Manager OEOP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, the MIT HR representative contacted me via email before the holidays to set up an interview after the holidays. I responded, but never heard back. I sent another email and the HR rep scheduled an interview. The interview involved meeting with the general manager, other program managers, an HR representative, and the program director. They typically split the interview into several days and take candidates out to lunch, but I live a significant distance away so I met with everyone on one day and they took me out for coffee.
Interview Questions: What is your experience connecting with a diverse group of students?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Internet application required CV and cover letter. Phone interview, on site interview including seminar before receiving an offer. During the phone interview I received general background research questions from 3 people and more sitting in the background. On site interview included 1:1 with 7 professors/researchers and a 1 hour seminar.
Interview Questions: Motivation

title: Masters In Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: One-hour interview on campus. Quite challenging.. A lot of tricky behavioral and technical questions. They invite for lunch with current students afterward. Overall pretty good experience. Took some time to prepare.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose the program?

title: Postdoctoral Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with a man at a conference and he persuaded me that I should do a postdoc. I don't remember who the man was but the professor was very nice. He gave me a lot of good advice
Interview Questions: Who are you?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Relatively straightforward. HR screen, two rounds of substantive interviews. Reasonably streamlined process, only the normal hoops to jump through, but not lots of extra steps or unnecessary stages. Good process.
Interview Questions: If offered the role what changes would you make?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Went well with lots of questions, I also toured the lab and they continued to ask more questoin reagarding how statics work  on a crane, where I had to answer questions such as moment arm and stresses acting on the metal. It was short and intense. I further talked about prsonal projcts and such.
Interview Questions: What is Pressure?

title: Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Resume submitted by one of the recruiting firms. Got shortlisted and scheduled for a written exam. After that followed by technical interview on various java, j2ee related technologies for about 2 hours. Got selected in the technical round and scheduled for a brief conversation about the current position and expectations  with the HR manager.
Interview Questions: Questions on Spring MVC, Java, Eclipse, Generics.

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Using SAP ERP software: review and edit purchase orders, resolve supply chain issues, and communicate directly with the supplier to optimize procurement process. Interact with the MIT community by providing assistance and instruction to follow purchasing policies and improve vendor relations. Lots of fun good time, free food every day
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview. Half an hour long. No small talk, straight to the point. They asked what I already knew about MIT and the department. There was a lot of time to ask questions to the interviewers. They finished by letting me know what the next steps were.
Interview Questions: What new skills have you learned in the past year?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience. I gave a presentation for the whole group. They asked technical questions related to my work and presentation. They also asked specifically about my papers and patents.
Interview Questions: What is the process to design metamaterials?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview about a week after I applied online went great and I was scheduled for an in person interview about 2 weeks later. First met with the manager for 20 minutes then 4 people together for 20 minutes. The experience with the manager was good, he was very nice and personable and discussed the job and asked me a few questions, however the panel interview was a horrible experience. The people on the panel, potential future coworkers, acted like I was wasting their time from the moment I met them. No smiling, no friendliness, and nothing to suggest that I might be someone who would actually be a coworker in the future and that they cared what I thought of them. I found the experience very unsettling. They seem to get a lot of their workers as temps but this is no reason for this kind of behavior.
Interview Questions: What kind of office environment do you prefer?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent an e-mail and got a reply in 5 min requesting for skype meeting.  Then I talked with all group members online. It was quick. They told me they already knew my works, they were following them. So on..
Interview Questions: are you okay with the animal experiment? Can you do it your self if you are trained?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I found the position on Craigslist and interviewed a few weeks after it was posted. I sat down with the post-docs looking to hire a technician. They told me about their research and asked me some basic questions about my past work.
Interview Questions: Why this lab?

title: Summer Programs Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Apply online with application and resume drop. Takes a bit of time to hear back (a month or 2). Then  you have Skype interview with the program coordinator and another member of the staff.
Interview Questions: Why this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted advisor you want to work with and meet for one-on-one interview.
Then set up a schedule to meet an future-advisor and discuss previous work and future work to do. After that he contacted me that I can work in his lab, he gave me time to think about it and I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your interest field of research?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I got a response on the same day of the job inquiry and got interviewed just a week later. I had the opportunity to interact with all the current members of the lab that I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Presentation on previous research.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: First got accepted to MIT. Then found a Research Assistant position. They were looking for a matching in interest, background and capabilities. Also the candidate should be open to exploring new areas, new datasets and be flexible if the project direction is constantly changed. Was required to handle projects with 3rd party companies.
Interview Questions: About by interest in machine learning. Also was asked about my programming and software development background, my interest in distributed systems.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: I was admitted as a graduate student to one of the major departments. The department asked me what mu interests were and matched me to some professors, i.e., they made me go talk to a bunch of professors who acted like I was wasting their time for being there, felt really disrespectful and pointless.
Interview Questions: They just made me talk to run down the clock, said a bunch of platitudes and that was it. Again, almost felt like sitting there and pretending to listen was a way for them to fulfill some quota, not seriously consider my candidacy. It took me about 3.5 years to get a stable RA (which, in my opinion, is ridiculous). But this was a good time to observe and realize the real reason -> they just hire each other -> the white professors hire white students (and some asians), the asian professors hire asian students (and some white ones), while I was told (I am a minority, not asian) "you just don't fit in here, good luck". A freaking joke.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MIT (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by an admin to schedule date and time for face-to-face with Assistant Director of Administration and Administrative Coordinator. Sat down with both at the same time. Was told that the person hired would support three different groups within the department, not including the group that the Administrative Coordinator is part of, which made me wonder why she was in the room since it makes more sense to include reps from the aforementioned groups.
Interview Questions: The Assistant Director seemed concerned that I may have been overqualified for the position.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MIT
Interview Descriptions: Met with every member of the lab for 30 minutes, gave a presentation summarizing my past research, had lunch with members of the lab, attended a department seminar, toured the facility, met with the lab manager, discussed possible projects in the lab
Interview Questions: why this lab, what projects i would be interested in

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MIT (Cambridge, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial telephonic interview to make sure that resume was checked out and to find common interest in research. By the end of the telephonic interview, I was asked to come over for an in person interview at the MIT campus in a couple of days. 
In person interview consisted of meeting the team members and going on a tour of the facilities and getting to know what the work would be like.
